data.text:
@stuartjdneil @quay_dr @MichaelWorobey How many early possible cases not around the market were vetted?
Do we know the data on that?
@quay_dr @stuartjdneil Obviously, even if he refuses to admit it in public

@quay_dr @stuartjdneil Per the official story (see NYT timeline), China was treating dozens of cases when reported on Dec 31, 2019 and they still wouldn’t admit community spread! We know this was BS. They couldn’t contain & waited too long to disclose. Data from this source & time is not to be trusted. https://t.co/iWSvGoFvdK
@stuartjdneil @quay_dr @MichaelWorobey Are we sure that the market wasn’t used informally to identify cases even prior to formally being part of case definition?
@quay_dr @stuartjdneil The spatial analysis is based on those famous 174 cases who were identified retrospectively. Are these biased towards the market?

@quay_dr you clearly haven't read anything @MichaelWorobey  has written. He clearly took this into account and shows that ascertainment bias can't explain the clustering of the early cases because they pre-date using the market in case definitions
